newsitem.title: UK: Cellnet seeks Britain's busiest business card.
newsitem.headline: Cellnet seeks Britain's busiest business card.

text.p: Mobile phone operator Cellnet said on Tuesday it had launched a nationwide hunt for Britain's "busiest" business card - the one bearing the most contact numbers.
Cellnet said its current champion is North Wales gentlemen's outfitter Richard Vaughan-Davies, who has nine different contact numbers covering four different stores.
Cellnet, which is owned by British Telecommunications Plc, is offering 1,000 stg and a new set of business cards to anyone who can beat Mr Vaughan-Davies' record.
The company is using the contest to promote its Personal Assistant service, which allows callers to give out a single phone number covering conventional and mobile phones and fax machines.
